intro: Friesodielsia sahyadrica, commonly known as the Western Ghats corymbiferous plant, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It is adapted to the humid and tropical climate of its native region. Due to its restricted distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study.
